title.children: Tip shop makes change after parents upset at 'unfair' prices for specialist items

image.altText: Nick Smith and Roy Quaden composite image.

props.synopsis: An independent review into last yearâ€™s tragic Sydney to Hobart yacht race, which resulted in the deaths of two sailors, has found helmets would do little to prevent catastrophic injuries.

image.altText: Have your say for the Tasmanian election.

props.synopsis: We want to know what issues matter most to you and what you want us to find out as Tasmania goes to another election.

props.synopsis: The Liberals candidate for Bass tells ABC Radio Mornings why Tasmania can't abandon the stadium.

image.altText: A person on stage sings into a microphone, set against a backdrop of vibrant red and yellow smoke.

props.synopsis: Known for his treatment as a child at Don Dale youth detention centre, Dylan Voller is trying to heal from his past by using music and songwriting.

title.children: Dylan Voller is using music to heal from his past

image.altText: Streams of light against a dark night sky

props.synopsis: Israel's multi-layered air defences are the envy of militaries around the world. Here's how the Iron Dome, David's Sling and Arrow systems work against drone and missile strikes.Â

title.children: The Iron Dome, David's Sling and Arrow: Israel's air defences visualised

image.altText: Police gathering at a crime scene in a suburban street, with police tape across the area.

props.synopsis: Police are hunting down two gunmen believed to be behind the shooting of three people at Auburn on Monday. The victims remain in hospital.

title.children: Underworld hits 'sloppy' as gunmen behind Sydney shooting at large

image.altText: Man in a yellow shirt holding up a phone showing a photo of an older Indian woman with her grandchild.

props.synopsis: Imtiaz Ali Syed still can't bring himself to tell his mother that his brother was on board the Air India flight which crashed while taking off from Ahmedabad.

title.children: 'Haven't lost hope': Family holding out for miracle after Air India crash

image.altText: Daniel sitting in a dimly lit room. A stream of light shines through the window blinds on his eye.

props.synopsis: An "overworked and under-resourced" state agency, the WA Public Trustee, is facing fresh allegations of overcharging a vulnerable woman to manage her assets while doing little to no work. The agency is set to face public scrutiny in a parliamentary committee hearing.

title.children: State charges woman with dementia $137k while managing assets at a loss

image.altText: Christine and her daughter Mia look out across their property, with their horses in the background.

props.synopsis: The proportion of Australian teenagers vaccinated against the virus that causes cervical cancer is the lowest it has been in almost 10 years.

title.children: Poor vaccine uptake a â€˜reality check' as situation worsening in Australia

image.altText: Four people stand inside a big cave.

props.synopsis: Deep in the Blue Mountains, archaeologists uncover artefacts that reveal secrets of the nation's Ice Age past.Â

title.children: Ancient cave reveals secrets about human life in Australia's Ice Age

title.children: 'Much younger and good-looking': South Korean leader offers assessment of PM

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Albanese to meet with new South Korean president and NATO secretary-general

image.altText: The exterior of a large hospital, including a sign pointing to Emergency.

props.synopsis: An explosive report alleging Queensland Health failed to refer a young patient to a special care team before he died by suicide was withheld from his distraught parents, prompting claims of a "cover-up".

title.children: Parents allege health service 'cover-up' of flaws in son's care

image.altText: Two women sit on an unfinished deck outside a converted shed. They are looking at the camera with neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Anastasia and Lexie Gunn say their two younger children were conceived using a different sperm donor to their eldest boy, even though they requested the same donor be used in all three cases.

title.children: Couple ask government for 'advocacy' amid dispute with IVF giant

image.altText: Andrew Hastie press conference

props.synopsis: After a former immigration detainee allegedly "critically injured" a man in Melbourne at the weekend, the shadow Home Affairs minister questions why the government is not using powers granted to it to re-detain the cohort.

title.children: Hastie warns government not to wait for NZYQ group to be deported, after alleged assault

image.altText: nsw police officers examine bushland in werrington after the body of a woman was found

props.synopsis: A 47-year-old man has been charged with the murder of a 47-year-old woman whose body was discovered in bushland in Werrington on the weekend.Â

title.children: Man charged with murder after woman's body found in Sydney bushland

image.altText: A close up of a sunscreen bottle.

props.synopsis: Peak consumer group Choice has defended its sunscreen testing and publicly released all tests in the face of criticism about its methods.

title.children: Choice doubles down on its sunscreen testing in the face of fierce criticism

image.altText: Two women hug

props.synopsis: Advocates say a critical undersupply of housing has forced people onto the streets. But as more councils disperse homeless camps, rough sleepers are left with nowhere to go.

title.children: Housing crisis forces retiree out onto the streets to help the homeless

image.altText: Two shell branded petrol pumps

props.synopsis: Australians could see petrol prices rise as high as $2.20 a litre, as analysts warn the spike in oil prices fuelled by the Israel-Iran conflict will flow "directly to the pump".

title.children: Petrol could soon hit $2.20 a litre as Israel-Iran conflict escalates

image.altText: A man walks through the sliding glass door of the Melbourne TAB.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest betting company Tabcorp has been fined more than $4 million for breaches of Australia's spam laws.

title.children: Tabcorp fined $4 million for spamming customers

image.altText: A person with an umbrella walks towards parliament house.

props.synopsis: A custom desk that the Department of Parliamentary Services spent $20,000 to make is back in the building after being mothballed, but the department is playing coy on who has it.

title.children: A notorious $20,000 desk in parliament's storage is out of retirement

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris pose for a photograph together.

props.synopsis: McLaren principal Andrea Stella doesn't see the team drastically changing its approach going forward after Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri's crash in Canada.Â

title.children: McLaren offers 'full support to Lando' after crashing into Piastri

image.altText: A line up of weights on racks in a gym.

props.synopsis: Illegal steroid use is on the rise among female bodybuilders, a study finds, but a lack of "steroid literacy" is making them vulnerable to its harmful side effects.

title.children: More young women are bodybuilding â€” and risking it with steroids

image.altText: A politician with blonde hair, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The NT attorney-general has revealed a $300,000 racism review into the NT Police Force has been scrapped, with the funding redirected to Legal Aid.

title.children: NT departmental racism reviews were ordered years ago. Here's where they're at

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has announced the location of the state's first permanent pill testing centre.

title.children: Permanent pill testing site announced for Fitzroy

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors tell Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial jury the mother of two carried out a "sinister deception" on her in-laws by using a "nourishing meal" as the vehicle for lethal doses of death-cap mushrooms.

title.children: 'Sinister deception' turned lunch into murder, prosecutor tells jury

image.altText: A man  in a fur hooded jumper bent over on a desk.

props.synopsis: A German court sentenced a Syrian doctor to life imprisonment for killing two people and torturing nine in Syria between 2011 and 2012.

title.children: 'Sadistic tendencies': Syrian doctor jailed for life in Germany on torture charges

image.altText: slug on a leaf

props.synopsis: Researchers say it's important to keep dogs away from slugs and snails, and stop them from eating them.Â

image.altText: Chris O'Connell hits a backhand shot

props.synopsis: Chris O'Connell and Alex Bolt are both sent packing at Queens, with O'Connell losing to Holger Rune after having mere hours to prepare.

title.children: Aussie loses at Queens after having just hours to prepare for clash with Danish star

image.altText: Shane Jacobson in a bright, summery shirt stands in front of the Mildura oranges mural.

props.synopsis: Data shows tourism to Victoria's north-west has dropped despite a $390,000 campaign locals say fails to capture "what Mildura is really about".

title.children: Heat on council over costly Tropical North Victoria campaign 'flop'

image.altText: man with moustache and beard wearing black sitting on chaise lounge at the Turner exhibition

props.synopsis: British painter Joseph Turner's profound impact on Australian landscape art is on show in an exhibition featuring his original paintings alongside the masters he inspired.

title.children: Joseph Turner exhibition showcases 'god-like figure in Australian art'

image.altText: A small bio module mounted to the outside of a lunar lander sits on the moon, with the Earth in the background

props.synopsis: While some people find it hard enough to keep their garden alive at home, an Australian team plans to send plants to the moon in the hope they will grow on the lunar surface.

title.children: The Australian scientists on a mission to grow plants on the moon

image.altText: A man and a woman sitting next to each other. The man is folding his arms.

props.synopsis: Record-breaking floods in NSW have helped open the Manning River's rare second entrance which, ironically, is expected to improve oyster quality in the region for years to come.Â

title.children: Record floods smash oyster stocks but bring ironic long-term benefit

image.altText: A queue of seven ambulances waiting outside a hospital.

props.synopsis: South Australia's ambulance union says ramping is happening at a major regional hospital, but Premier Peter Malinauskas disagrees.

title.children: Ambulances queued outside SA hospital not ramping, premier says
